ARABIC: إِنَّمَا قَوْلُنَا لِشَىْءٍ إِذَآ أَرَدْنَٰهُ أَن نَّقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Our Word to a thing when We desire it is just to say to it 'Be!' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet when We will a thing We have only to say: "Be", and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (As for the possibility of resurrection, bear in mind that) whenever We do will something, We have to do no more than say: "Be", and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When We want to bring something into existence, Our command is, "Exist," and it comes into existence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And Our command for anything to occur, when We will it, is that We only say to it, “Be” – and it thereupon happens.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, Our Word to a thing when We intend it, is only that We say unto it: "Be!" - and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Our word for a thing when We intend it, is only that We say to it, Be, and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The only words We say to a thing, when We desire it, is that We say to it 'Be,' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And Our word unto a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say unto it: Be! and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When We will something to happen, all that We say is, "Be!" and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Our only saying unto a thing, when We intend it, is that We say unto it: be, and it becometh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: All that We say to a thing, when We will it, is to say to it ‘Be!’ and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For to anything which We have willed, We but say the word, "Be", and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! Our Word unto a thing when We intend it, is only that We say unto it: "Be!" and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When We decree a thing, We only say: 'Be' and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When We intend for something to happen, We say to it, “Be,” and it becomes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:40] All that We say to a thing, when We will it, that is, when We will that it come into existence (qawlunā is a subject, the predicate of which is [what follows]) is to say to it ‘Be,’ and it is, in other words, and that [thing] is (a variant reading [for fa-yakūnu] has fa-yakūna as a supplement to naqūla). The verse is intended as an affirmation of the power [of God] to resurrect.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And Our word unto a thing) Our command for the advent of the Hour, (when We intend it, is only that We say unto it: Be! and it is).
